Package item

Class Item

java.lang.Object
item.Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
Chip, ColourKey, EmptyItem
public class Item extends Object
Represents a generic item within a game. This class provides basic properties and methods that are common to all items, such as picked-up status, position, and a key for identification.

      Sets the position of the item.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the item's position.
      y - The y-coordinate of the item's position.

    • createKey

      public String createKey(boolean pickedUp, Color color)
      Creates a key for the item based on its picked-up status and color. The method generates a unique key representing the state and type of the item.
      Parameters:
      pickedUp - Indicates whether the item has been picked up.
      color - The color associated with the item.
      Returns:
      A string key representing the item's state and type.

    • setPickedUp

      public void setPickedUp(Boolean pickedUp)
      Sets the picked-up status of the item. This method is used to change the state of the item to indicate whether it has been picked up.
      Parameters:
      pickedUp - The new picked-up status to set for the item.

    • getxPos

      public int getxPos()
      Retrieves the x-coordinate of the item's position. This coordinate represents the item's horizontal position in the game world.
      Returns:
      The x-coordinate of the item's position.

    • setxPos

      public void setxPos(int xPos)
      Sets the x-coordinate of the item's position. This method allows for changing the item's horizontal position in the game world.
      Parameters:
      xPos - The new x-coordinate to set for the item's position.

    • getyPos

      public int getyPos()
      Retrieves the y-coordinate of the item's position. This coordinate represents the item's vertical position in the game world.
      Returns:
      The y-coordinate of the item's position.

    • setyPos

      public void setyPos(int yPos)
      Sets the y-coordinate of the item's position. This method allows for changing the item's vertical position in the game world.
      Parameters:
      yPos - The new y-coordinate to set for the item's position.

    • pickUp

      public void pickUp()
      Marks the item as picked up. This method can be overridden by subclasses to implement specific pickup behaviors.
